name: Use lowercase for control structures in Methods and Functions (PHP)
description: This rule searches for all Methods and Functions containing control structures not in lowercase.
output:
This report lists all Methods and Functions containing control structures not in lowercase.

This QR provides the following information:
Method or Function full name.
rationale: Use of naming convention makes the source code easier to read and therefore to maintain.
remediation: Modify the source code to reduce the number of Methods and Functions containing control structures not in lowercase.
remediationSample:
<?php
class ClassTest {
    function testCondition() {
        $status = 0;

        if ($status === 0) {          //VIOLATION REMOVED
            echo "section: status",PHP_EOL;
        } elseif ($status === 1) {    //VIOLATION REMOVED
            echo "section: status",PHP_EOL;
        }
    }
}
$obj = new ClassTest();
$obj-> testCondition();
?>
